byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz reported from Plattsburgh, and Nate Schweber from Dannemora. William K. Rashbaum and Rick Rojas contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: New York State Dept of Corrections says corrections officer at Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora has been put on administrative leave in connection with investigation of prison escape of Richard Matt and David Sweat; investigators are focused on as many as four corrections officers in investigation; police are looking into possible sighting of escapees in Steuben County.
lead_paragraph: The move involving the officer at the Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, N.Y., came as the authorities said they were investigating a possible sighting of the two missing convicts.

headline.main: New York Prison Officer Is Placed on Leave Amid Escape Investigation
